snippet.title: Arabian Fight Longplay (Arcade) [QHD]
snippet.description:
Developed and published by Sega in 1992

Follow me on Twitter @ https://twitter.com/Al82_Retro
Get Great Retro Scene News @ http://www.vintageisthenewold.com

Based on the same System 32 hardware as Golden Axe: The Revenge of Death Adder, Arabian Fight at least impresses in the visual department. The Anime themed graphics and sprites are pretty detailed, and the backdrops and stages, with their multiple layers of parallax scrolling, look impressive.

Unfortunately, the actual gameplay is poor, at least in my opinion. The collision detection between the sprites is inconsistent, with punches and kicks failing to land properly.

It's a interesting game, but probably not one you're going to revisit very often.

Oh, and props to the developers for naming one of the characters "Sinbat"... definitely not Sinbad or anything...

Chapters
00:00 Attract mode/intro
01:30 Stage 1: Pirate Ship
03:42 Stage 2: Pyramid Power
07:47 Stage 3: Desert Storm
12:33 Stage 4: Desert Street
15:30 Stage 5: Panic in the Palace
21:21 Stage 6: Hell on the Hill
28:32 Stage 7: Castle of the Devil
41:51 Ending

#arabianfight
#sega
#retrogaming
